intro: Corydalis hallaisanensis, commonly known as the Hallaisan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
